channel.title: Panic Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Follow the sidequests, subplots, and accidents of history that round out Portland's [Panic](https://panic.com).
channel.itunes:author: Panic
channel.itunes:summary: Given enough time, even a business starts to collect some interesting stories. And Panic, Portland's long-standing software company/video game publisher/hardware developer/who knows what, has been around for a long time. Our host, Christa Mrgan, takes a look at the strange, funny, interesting, and useless parts of Panic, through interviews, stories, and Cabel's rambling asides. Now Panic lore can be shared by everyone, for better or worse.
channel.description: Given enough time, even a business starts to collect some interesting stories. And Panic, Portland's long-standing software company/video game publisher/hardware developer/who knows what, has been around for a long time. Our host, Christa Mrgan, takes a look at the strange, funny, interesting, and useless parts of Panic, through interviews, stories, and Cabel's rambling asides. Now Panic lore can be shared by everyone, for better or worse.
channel.itunes:keywords: panic, panic inc, playdate, mac, apple, software, tech

item.title: The Story of Playdate
item.itunes:title: The Story of Playdate
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: Find out how an offhand idea to mark the 15th anniversary of a software company launched a decade-long saga of twists, turns, and mini-boss battles that led to the creation of a handheld gaming console as surprising and unique as its creators. Pre-order day is finally here, but it’s dangerous to go alone. Take this adorable yellow box, and let’s get crankin’… on the story of Playdate.
item.content:encoded:
Find out how an offhand idea to mark the 15th anniversary of a software company launched a decade-long saga of twists, turns, and mini-boss battles that led to the creation of a handheld gaming console as surprising and unique as its creators. Pre-order day is finally here, but it’s dangerous to go alone. Take this adorable yellow box, and let’s get crankin’… on the story of Playdate.

Show Notes

  • Playdate website
  • Teenage Engineering
  • Nintendo Game and Watch
  • Famicom Disk System
  • Metric Designworks
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: A limited-run anniversary clock turns into a handheld gaming console with a crank.
item.itunes:summary: Find out how an offhand idea to mark the 15th anniversary of a software company launched a decade-long saga of twists, turns, and mini-boss battles that led to the creation of a handheld gaming console as surprising and unique as its creators. Pre-order day is finally here, but it’s dangerous to go alone. Take this adorable yellow box, and let’s get crankin’… on the story of Playdate.

item.title: Totally Sidetalkin'
item.itunes:title: Totally Sidetalkin'
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: How the Nokia N-Gage failed so spectacularly that it became a meme before social media really existed. And what that has to do with Panic, exactly.
item.content:encoded:
How the Nokia N-Gage failed so spectacularly that it became a meme before social media really existed. And what that has to do with Panic, exactly.

Show Notes

  • Sidetalkin.com
  • Sidetalking.com
  • The Nokia N-Gage on Wikipedia
  • The N-Gage website as it appeared in April 2004
  • Sidetalking on Know Your Meme
  • "No More Sidetalking" Nokia N-Gage QD commercial
  • Chris Kohler
  • Alex Pasco
  • Ola Carlsson
  • Chris Morris
  • Jussi Solja
  • Gedeon Maheux
  • K. Mike Merrill
  • Iconfactory
  • The Sexy Beast
  • KMikeyM
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: Panic and the N-Gage Superfan
item.itunes:summary: How the Nokia N-Gage failed so spectacularly that it became a meme before social media really existed. And what that has to do with Panic, exactly.
item.itunes:keywords: panic, n-gage, sidetalking, sidetalkin, early internet, meme

item.title: Audion & On
item.itunes:title: Audion & On
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: How did a fierce competition with a rival lead Steven Frank and Cabel Sasser to make a life-changing decision in a meeting with one of their biggest idols... and one of their arch nemeses?
item.content:encoded:
How did a fierce competition with a rival lead Steven Frank and Cabel Sasser to make a life-changing decision in a meeting with one of their biggest idols… and one of their arch nemeses?

Show Notes

  • Capture of the Audion Faces page from February 2001
  • Cabel’s 2004 blog post on the story (and retirement) of Audion
  • Welcome to Macintosh Episode 12: Don’t Panic
  • SoundJam MP
  • Casady & Greene
  • Felt Tip Software
  • Jeremy Bailey on Twitter
  • Jake Rodkin on Twitter
  • Wade Cosgrove on Twitter
  • Dan Messing on Twitter
  • Michael Buckley’s website
  • Try the Audion web player built by Michael Buckley
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: Community, and the cascading effects of the choices we make
item.itunes:summary: How did a fierce competition with a rival lead Steven Frank and Cabel Sasser to make a life-changing decision in a meeting with one of their biggest idols... and one of their arch nemeses?

item.title: Our Monogamous Follow Heart
item.itunes:title: Our Monogamous Follow Heart
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: An act of social media spite, an unlikely friendship, and a lot of fast food coupons. How did signing up for a Twitter account to do support lead to an odd and endearing relationship… and whatever happened to the cardboard friends we made along the way?
item.content:encoded:
An act of social media spite, an unlikely friendship, and a lot of fast food coupons. How did signing up for a Twitter account to do support lead to an odd and endearing relationship… and whatever happened to the cardboard friends we made along the way?

Show Notes

  • Panic’s Twitter
  • Carl’s Jr.'s Twitter
  • Donold Duck’s Twitter
  • Eat the Ball
  • Burnside, our tweet-to-email gateway
  • A Twitter thread about the chef checks
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: Whatever happened to the cardboard friends we made along the way?
item.itunes:summary: An act of social media spite, an unlikely friendship, and a lot of fast food coupons. How did signing up for a Twitter account to do support lead to an odd and endearing relationship… and whatever happened to the cardboard friends we made along the way?
item.itunes:keywords: panic, twitter, twitter support, tech support, carls jr

item.title: Pantscast
item.itunes:title: Pantscast
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: Most of us remember the iPhone app store launch in 2008 and the iPhone app gold rush that followed. Indie developers flocked to the platform, all determined to build a breakout app that would earn them millions. And pretty soon that gold rush… turned into a brown rush. Enter Panic, with a ridiculous novelty app and an elaborate fake backstory for a German company that didn't exist.
item.content:encoded:
Most of us remember the iPhone app store launch in 2008 and the iPhone app gold rush that followed. Indie developers flocked to the platform, all determined to build a breakout app that would earn them millions. And pretty soon that gold rush… turned into a brown rush. Enter Panic, with a ridiculous novelty app and an elaborate fake backstory for a German company that didn’t exist.

Show Notes

  • Twitterrific
  • 2008 Apple Design Awards
  • Chevy’s
  • Daring Fireball
  • The Coding Monkeys
  • Idle Thumbs
  • Overcast
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: Enter Panic, with a ridiculous novelty app and an elaborate fake backstory for a German company that didn't exist.
item.itunes:summary: Most of us remember the iPhone app store launch in 2008 and the iPhone app gold rush that followed. item.itunes:keywords: pantscast, app store, fart app, panic, gmbh, hosensoft

item.title: Untitled Goose Game
item.itunes:title: Untitled Goose Game
item.author: podcasting@panic.com (Panic)
item.description: It's a lovely morning in the village, and you are a horrible goose. How did four-person indie game studio House House create the anti-hero internet sensation that honked its way into our hearts in 2019? And how did a small-ish company on the other side of the world — one known primarily for making Mac and iOS software — come to be the publisher of that game?
item.content:encoded:
It’s a lovely morning in the village, and you are a horrible goose. How did four-person indie game studio House House create the anti-hero internet sensation that honked its way into our hearts in 2019? And how did a small-ish company on the other side of the world — one known primarily for making Mac and iOS software — come to be the publisher of that game?

Show Notes

  • House House
  • Untitled Goose Game
  • Préludes by Claude Debussy
  • Panic’s booth at PAX West • 2018 2019
item.itunes:author: Panic
item.itunes:subtitle: It's a lovely morning in the village, and you are a horrible goose.
item.itunes:summary: It's a lovely morning in the village, and you are a horrible goose. How did four-person indie game studio House House create the anti-hero internet sensation that honked its way into our hearts in 2019? And how did a small-ish company on the other side of the world — one known primarily for making Mac and iOS software — come to be the publisher of that game?
item.itunes:keywords: untitled goose game, panic, house house, goose
